Certainly. The easiest way to clean your cast iron pan would be as follows:

1. While the pan is still warm, scrape out any excess food particles using a soft-bristled brush or a plastic scraper.

2. Rinse the pan under hot water. If you choose to use soap, add a small amount of soap to the water and then rinse the pan thoroughly. Make sure to remove all soap residue.

3. Dry the pan using a clean towel or by placing it over low heat on the stovetop.

4. Optionally, you can apply a small amount of vegetable oil to the pan to help prevent rust.

Remember, the key to maintaining your cast iron pan is to ensure that it is completely dry after cleaning to prevent rust.
